alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Rock; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 7:47PM CST until February 18 at 8:45PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Walworth County in southeastern Wisconsin... Rock County in south central Wisconsin... Southern Waukesha County in southeastern Wisconsin... Southeastern Jefferson County in southeastern Wisconsin... * Until 845 PM CST. * At 745 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Oconomowoc to near Albany, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstates 90 and 43. Locations impacted include... Waukesha, Janesville, New Berlin, Beloit, Whitewater, Fort Atkinson, Elkhorn, Delavan, South Beloit, Mukwonago, Milton, East Troy, Wales, Vernon, Ottawa, Dousman, Clinton, North Prairie, Palmyra and Darien. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
